intro: Sphedamnocarpus woodianus, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by distinctive, kidney-shaped fruits. Its botanical features include a thick, fleshy pericarp that encloses the seeds. Sphedamnocarpus woodianus is often found in forested areas and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
